titleStmt.title: John Quincy Adams Diary Digital Project

div.p: 1.VII. Attended the funeral of Constant Freeman 4th. Auditor of the Treasury. At 11. this Morning. The procession went from his house, to the Roman Catholic Church where a short service was performed by the Curate Matthews— Mr Frye with me— Returned to the Office. W. C. Bradley of Vermont to recommend Slade for Freeman’s Office; and Hall for Slade’s place in the Department of State. Mr J. Finch an Englishman, with a Letter from Josiah Quincy. Wishes to visit the President. Conway the Delegate from Arkansas; about the Message asking an Act to legalise Governor Miller’s Acts. I called at the President’s with despatches from H. Nelson, D. Sheldon, J. M. Forbes and C. S. Todd.
